004
005package edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics;
006
007import static edu.wpi.first.units.Units.Meters;
008
009import edu.wpi.first.math.MathSharedStore;
010import edu.wpi.first.math.MathUsageId;
011import edu.wpi.first.math.MathUtil;
012import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Twist2d;
013import edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics.proto.DifferentialDriveKinematicsProto;
014import edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics.struct.DifferentialDriveKinematicsStruct;
015import edu.wpi.first.units.Distance;
016import edu.wpi.first.units.Measure;
017import edu.wpi.first.util.protobuf.ProtobufSerializable;
018import edu.wpi.first.util.struct.StructSerializable;
019
020/**
021 * Helper class that converts a chassis velocity (dx and dtheta components) to left and right wheel
022 * velocities for a differential drive.
023 *
024 * <p>Inverse kinematics converts a desired chassis speed into left and right velocity components
025 * whereas forward kinematics converts left and right component velocities into a linear and angular
026 * chassis speed.
027 */
028public class DifferentialDriveKinematics
029    implements Kinematics<DifferentialDriveWheelSpeeds, DifferentialDriveWheelPositions>,
030        ProtobufSerializable,
031        StructSerializable {
032  /** Differential drive trackwidth. */
033  public final double trackWidthMeters;
034
035  /** DifferentialDriveKinematics protobuf for serialization. */
036  public static final DifferentialDriveKinematicsProto proto =
037      new DifferentialDriveKinematicsProto();
038
039  /** DifferentialDriveKinematics struct for serialization. */
040  public static final DifferentialDriveKinematicsStruct struct =
041      new DifferentialDriveKinematicsStruct();
042
043  /**
044   * Constructs a differential drive kinematics object.
045   *
046   * @param trackWidthMeters The track width of the drivetrain. Theoretically, this is the distance
047   *     between the left wheels and right wheels. However, the empirical value may be larger than
048   *     the physical measured value due to scrubbing effects.
049   */
050  public DifferentialDriveKinematics(double trackWidthMeters) {
051    this.trackWidthMeters = trackWidthMeters;
052    MathSharedStore.reportUsage(MathUsageId.kKinematics_DifferentialDrive, 1);
053  }
054
055  /**
056   * Constructs a differential drive kinematics object.
057   *
058   * @param trackWidth The track width of the drivetrain. Theoretically, this is the distance
059   *     between the left wheels and right wheels. However, the empirical value may be larger than
060   *     the physical measured value due to scrubbing effects.
061   */
062  public DifferentialDriveKinematics(Measure<Distance> trackWidth) {
063    this(trackWidth.in(Meters));
064  }
065
066  /**
067   * Returns a chassis speed from left and right component velocities using forward kinematics.
068   *
069   * @param wheelSpeeds The left and right velocities.
070   * @return The chassis speed.
071   */
072  @Override
073  public ChassisSpeeds toChassisSpeeds(DifferentialDriveWheelSpeeds wheelSpeeds) {
074    return new ChassisSpeeds(
075        (wheelSpeeds.leftMetersPerSecond + wheelSpeeds.rightMetersPerSecond) / 2,
076        0,
077        (wheelSpeeds.rightMetersPerSecond - wheelSpeeds.leftMetersPerSecond) / trackWidthMeters);
078  }
079
080  /**
081   * Returns left and right component velocities from a chassis speed using inverse kinematics.
082   *
083   * @param chassisSpeeds The linear and angular (dx and dtheta) components that represent the
084   *     chassis' speed.
085   * @return The left and right velocities.
086   */
087  @Override
088  public DifferentialDriveWheelSpeeds toWheelSpeeds(ChassisSpeeds chassisSpeeds) {
089    return new DifferentialDriveWheelSpeeds(
090        chassisSpeeds.vxMetersPerSecond
091            - trackWidthMeters / 2 * chassisSpeeds.omegaRadiansPerSecond,
092        chassisSpeeds.vxMetersPerSecond
093            + trackWidthMeters / 2 * chassisSpeeds.omegaRadiansPerSecond);
094  }
095
096  @Override
097  public Twist2d toTwist2d(
098      DifferentialDriveWheelPositions start, DifferentialDriveWheelPositions end) {
099    return toTwist2d(end.leftMeters - start.leftMeters, end.rightMeters - start.rightMeters);
100  }
101
102  /**
103   * Performs forward kinematics to return the resulting Twist2d from the given left and right side
104   * distance deltas. This method is often used for odometry -- determining the robot's position on
105   * the field using changes in the distance driven by each wheel on the robot.
106   *
107   * @param leftDistanceMeters The distance measured by the left side encoder.
108   * @param rightDistanceMeters The distance measured by the right side encoder.
109   * @return The resulting Twist2d.
110   */
111  public Twist2d toTwist2d(double leftDistanceMeters, double rightDistanceMeters) {
112    return new Twist2d(
113        (leftDistanceMeters + rightDistanceMeters) / 2,
114        0,
115        (rightDistanceMeters - leftDistanceMeters) / trackWidthMeters);
116  }
117
118  @Override
119  public DifferentialDriveWheelPositions copy(DifferentialDriveWheelPositions positions) {
120    return new DifferentialDriveWheelPositions(positions.leftMeters, positions.rightMeters);
121  }
122
123  @Override
124  public DifferentialDriveWheelPositions interpolate(
125      DifferentialDriveWheelPositions startValue,
126      DifferentialDriveWheelPositions endValue,
127      double t) {
128    return new DifferentialDriveWheelPositions(
129        MathUtil.interpolate(startValue.leftMeters, endValue.leftMeters, t),
130        MathUtil.interpolate(startValue.rightMeters, endValue.rightMeters, t));
131  }
132}
